summary: The China Advanced Technology Monitoring Act mandates the Secretary of Defense, in consultation with other agencies, to submit an annual report to Congress for five years. This report will assess China's advanced semiconductor manufacturing capabilities, including its industrial policies, technological developments, international collaborations, and the impact of export controls.  It also requires analysis of the implications for US competitiveness, national security, and the economy, with both unclassified and classified components, made available publicly.
